data.content:
CSR Programs Using AI for Women Empowerment



AI Assistant

CSR Partner(s)

Focus Area

AI Features

Yashoda AI

NCW + Future Shift Labs

Digital literacy & safety

Conversational agent, local language

AI Kiran

Verix + Govt + CSR donors

Women in AI careers

Mentorship, career agents, badges

AI for All

Intel + Ministry of Edu

AI education for all

Learning modules, certification



What Is Yashoda AI?

Yashoda AI is a government-backed AI assistant launched by the National Commission for Women (NCW) in collaboration with Future Shift Labs. It‚Äôs designed to empower women‚Äîespecially in rural and semi-urban India‚Äîby teaching them how to use digital tools safely, understand AI, and protect themselves online.

Unlike typical apps, Yashoda AI is not available for download. Instead, it‚Äôs deployed through community workshops, colleges, police departments, and NGOs. It works like a chatbot that talks to users in simple language and local dialects.

 Purpose of Yashoda AI

The main goals of Yashoda AI are:

üß† Teach women what AI is and how it affects their lives

üîê Help women stay safe online (cybersecurity, privacy)

üì± Build confidence in using mobile phones, apps, and social media

üö® Guide women on how to report cybercrime or digital abuse

üí¨ Promote digital leadership and awareness in communities

How Yashoda AI Reaches Women

Yashoda AI is deployed through organized sessions in partnership with local institutions. Here's how it reaches different groups:

1. Universities and Colleges

Workshops are held for students and faculty

Women police officers are invited to participate

Sessions include interactive lessons and live demos

2. Police Departments

Used in cybercrime awareness programs

Helps women understand how to report digital threats

Builds trust between law enforcement and women

3. Self-Help Groups (SHGs) and ASHA Workers

Sessions are conducted in villages and towns

Targets grassroots women leaders and health workers

Focuses on practical safety and digital literacy

4. Community Centers and NGOs

Delivered in low-bandwidth areas using shared devices

Supported by CSR donors and local government bodies

Accessible to women with limited tech exposure

 How Yashoda AI Works (Technology)

Yashoda AI is a conversational AI assistant‚Äîlike a chatbot that talks to users. It uses:

Technologies Behind It

Natural Language Processing (NLP) to understand questions

Multilingual support for Tamil, Hindi, and other Indian languages

Scenario-based learning to teach through real-life examples

Interactive quizzes to reinforce learning

Lightweight deployment for low-internet environments

It doesn‚Äôt require high-end phones or fast internet. It‚Äôs designed to work in community settings with basic devices.

 What Yashoda AI Teaches (Course Levels)

Yashoda AI offers structured learning in three levels:

Level 1: AI Awareness

What is AI?

How does AI affect daily life?

Examples of AI in mobile apps, banking, and social media

Level 2: Digital Safety & Privacy

How to set strong passwords

How to spot scams, fake messages, and phishing

How to report cybercrime (with links to government portals)

Level 3: Digital Leadership

How to become a ‚ÄúDigital Sakhi‚Äù (digital friend/guide)

How to teach others in your community

How to use AI tools for education, business, or outreach

Each level includes:

Simple explanations

Real-life scenarios

Quizzes and certifications

Local language support

Impact of Yashoda AI

Yashoda AI has already made a strong impact:

‚úÖ Trained over 2,500 women across India

‚úÖ Reached students, SHG members, ASHA workers, and entrepreneurs

‚úÖ Helped women become confident digital users

‚úÖ Created community leaders who teach others

‚úÖ Supported India‚Äôs mission for women-led digital development

 

 How the Yashoda AI Initiative Started

Initiated by: National Commission for Women (NCW)

Developed by: Future Shift Labs

Launch Date: May 22, 2025, at Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Rohilkhand University, Bareilly

Purpose of the Initiative

Equip women with AI literacy

Promote digital inclusion

Empower women in cybersecurity, digital privacy, and safe online practices

Align with India‚Äôs vision of women-led development and Viksit Bharat

How Yashoda AI Was Developed

While exact development timelines aren‚Äôt publicly disclosed, here‚Äôs a typical breakdown based on similar AI literacy projects:

1. Planning Phase (2‚Äì4 weeks)

Define goals and target audience (rural and semi-urban women)

Identify key learning areas: AI basics, cybersecurity, privacy

Partner with universities, police departments, and NGOs

2. Content & Curriculum Design (3‚Äì6 weeks)

Create multilingual learning modules

Develop scenario-based lessons and quizzes

Align with government safety guidelines and digital policies

3. Technical Development (4‚Äì8 weeks)

Build the conversational AI assistant

Integrate Natural Language Processing (NLP) for local languages

Optimize for low-bandwidth environments and shared devices

4. Pilot Testing & Deployment (2‚Äì4 weeks)

Test in selected colleges and community centers

Train facilitators and volunteers

Collect feedback and refine the assistant

Smile Foundation:

What Is Smile Foundation?

Smile Foundation is a nonprofit organization in India that works to improve education, healthcare, and livelihood for underprivileged communities. One of its key missions is empowering women, especially in rural and semi-urban areas.

To scale its impact, Smile Foundation partners with CSR programs from major tech companies like:

Infosys

TCS (Tata Consultancy Services)

Wipro

American Express

These companies support Smile Foundation through CSR funding, technology support, and volunteer mentoring.

Goals of the Program

The main goals are to:

üß† Teach women how to use digital tools confidently

üíº Help women start small businesses or find jobs

üí∞ Improve financial literacy and independence

üì± Promote safe and smart use of mobile phones and apps

ü§ñ Introduce AI tools that make learning and business easier



What Women Learn

1. Digital Literacy

Women learn:

How to use smartphones, internet, email, and apps

How to fill online forms and use government websites

How to stay safe online and protect their privacy

How to use AI-powered learning apps that adjust to their level

2. Entrepreneurship Skills

Women are trained to:

Start small businesses (like tailoring, food stalls, crafts)

Use WhatsApp Business, Instagram, and online marketplaces

Create digital catalogs and manage orders

Use AI tools to track sales, customer behavior, and marketing

3. Financial Literacy

Women learn:

How to use UPI, mobile wallets, and online banking

How to avoid digital fraud and scams

How to budget, save, and plan their finances

AI apps help guide them and send alerts for risky transactions

4. STEM Education for Girls

Girls in schools are taught:

Basics of coding and robotics

What AI is and how it works

Career options in science and technology

Supported by Infosys and TCS through scholarships and workshops

5. Career Re-entry Programs

Women who left jobs due to marriage, motherhood, or other reasons are:

Trained in updated tech skills

Mentored by professionals

Connected to job opportunities

AI tools match them to jobs and track their progress



ü§ñ How AI Is Used in These Programs

AI Feature

How It Helps Women

Personalized Learning

Adapts lessons to each woman‚Äôs pace and level

Chatbots

Answer questions and guide users step by step

Voice Interfaces

Help women who struggle with reading or typing

Multilingual Support

Teaches in Tamil, Hindi, and other local languages

Business Analytics

Helps women track sales, customer trends, and inventory

Financial Alerts

Warns about fraud and helps with budgeting

AI turns smartphones into personal tutors, business advisors, and safety guides‚Äîmaking learning accessible and practical.



üß≠ How AI Finds, Adjusts, and Gives Lessons (Step-by-Step)

Step 1: User Opens the Learning App or Assistant

The woman uses a mobile app, chatbot, or voice assistant provided during training.

Step 2: AI Asks Simple Questions to Understand the User

Example: ‚ÄúDo you know how to use WhatsApp?‚Äù or ‚ÄúWhat language do you prefer?‚Äù

Step 3: AI Adjusts the Lesson Based on Her Answers

Beginners get basic lessons (e.g., how to open an app)

Advanced users get business or financial modules

Step 4: AI Gives Lessons in Simple Language

Lessons are shown as short videos, voice instructions, or step-by-step guides

Step 5: AI Tracks Progress

Remembers completed lessons, struggles, and preferences

Recommends next steps or repeats topics if needed

Step 6: AI Sends Alerts and Tips

Warns about scams, suggests business tools, and offers financial advice



ü§ù CSR Partners Supporting the Program

Company

Contribution

Infosys

STEM education, scholarships, career mentoring

TCS

‚ÄúRebegin‚Äù program for career re-entry

Wipro

Digital inclusion and tech skilling

American Express

Digital training for women graduates

These companies support Smile Foundation under India‚Äôs CSR law, which requires them to spend 2% of net profits on social impact.



üìà Impact So Far

‚úÖ Over 150,000 women trained in digital literacy and entrepreneurship in 2023

‚úÖ Active in 25 states, reaching 1.5 million people annually

‚úÖ Supported micro-business growth and job placements

‚úÖ Improved digital confidence and safety awareness

‚úÖ Created community leaders who teach others



AI-Based Difference Between Smile Foundation & Yashoda AI

üü© Smile Foundation‚Äôs AI Programs

These are many small AI tools used in different ways to help women learn, grow businesses, and manage money.

‚úÖ How AI Is Used:

Learning App: AI adjusts lessons based on each woman‚Äôs level (beginner or advanced).

Chatbots: Answer questions like ‚ÄúHow do I use UPI?‚Äù or ‚ÄúHow to sell online?‚Äù

Voice Support: Women can speak instead of typing‚Äîgreat for those who can‚Äôt read or write well.

Local Languages: AI speaks in Tamil, Hindi, etc.

Business Tools: AI helps track sales, customers, and gives marketing tips.

Financial Alerts: AI warns about scams or risky spending.

üéØ Goal:

To help women become confident with digital tools, start businesses, and manage money.

üü® Yashoda AI

This is one focused AI assistant‚Äîlike a chatbot teacher‚Äîused in workshops to teach women about AI and digital safety.

‚úÖ How AI Is Used:

Chatbot Assistant: Talks to women in simple language.

Scenario-Based Learning: Gives examples like ‚ÄúWhat to do if someone sends a fake link?‚Äù

Quizzes: Tests understanding after each topic.

Local Language Support: Speaks in Tamil, Hindi, etc.

Offline-Friendly: Works in low internet areas during training sessions.

üéØ Goal:

To teach women how to stay safe online, understand AI, and report cybercrime.



Feature

Smile Foundation AI

Yashoda AI

AI Type

Many small tools

One chatbot assistant

Used For

Learning, business, finance

AI awareness and safety

Access

Public apps and training

Used only in workshops

Language Support

Tamil, Hindi, voice-enabled

Tamil, Hindi, simple dialogue

Personalization

Adapts to user level

Fixed lessons and quizzes

Goal

Empower through tech & business

Empower through safety & awareness











Comparison: GenAI for Nonprofit vs Yashoda AI vs Smile Foundation AI

Feature / AI Capability

GenAI System (Custom Virtual Staff)

Yashoda AI (Safety Chatbot)

Smile Foundation AI (Learning Toolkit)

AI Role

Full virtual team member

Chatbot teacher

Learning assistant

Scope of Tasks

End-to-end: grant search, application, reporting, outreach

Focused: teach AI safety and digital literacy

Modular: teach digital skills, business, finance

Autonomy Level

High ‚Äî AI acts independently with minimal human input

Low ‚Äî used only in workshops

Medium ‚Äî supports learning, needs human review

AI Behavior

Proactive, strategic, context-aware

Reactive, scenario-based

Adaptive, lesson-based

Personalization

Tailors proposals, reports, and outreach per funder

Fixed content per session

Adapts lessons to user level

Data Integration

Pulls from website, surveys, media folders

No external data integration

Uses internal learning modules

Impact Analysis

AI analyzes behavioral change (confidence, resilience)

No impact tracking

Tracks basic metrics (skills, attendance)

Document Handling

Auto-assembles applications with attachments

No document handling

Manual uploads for training

Donor Engagement

AI sends emails, books meetings, tracks responses

No donor engagement

Donor reports are manually prepared

Grant Discovery

AI crawls web, filters by mission, updates live database

No grant discovery

Grant search is manual

Reporting & Dashboards

AI creates visual reports, summaries, case studies

No reporting

Basic reporting with human input

Scalability

Manages multiple pipelines simultaneously

Used in limited sessions

Scales across training centers
